elements.title: Hebbel-Theater
elements.contents: ... that the Hebbel-Theater (pictured), designed by Oskar Kaufmann and opened in 1908, was the only theatre in Berlin operational in 1945?

elements.title: Lucy Smith Millikin
elements.contents: ... that Lucy Smith Millikin was one of the first Latter Day Saints to participate in baptism for the dead?

elements.title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2
elements.contents: ... that during the early development of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2, the studio behind the game was suddenly dissolved?

elements.title: Angus McIntosh
elements.contents: ... that Angus McIntosh was a Scottish historical linguist who used his skills to decipher German encryptions at Bletchley Park?

elements.title: least affected by the Black Death
elements.contents: ... that Poland was one of the places in Europe least affected by the Black Death?

elements.title: Gun Bergman
elements.contents: ... that Gun Bergman produced the Swedish translation of Nobel laureate Ivo Andrić's best-known work, The Bridge on the Drina?

elements.title: gourd mouth organ
elements.contents: ... that the gourd mouth organ is said to have been created in the third millennium B.C. as a likeness of the Phoenix?

elements.title: their academic regalia
elements.contents: ... that beginning in 1763, Columbia University students were required to wear their academic regalia daily in order to steer them away from New York City brothels?
